result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A. VANDERLINDEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no possession nor consume alcohol or illegal drugs.  

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

The court authorizes the Department of Corrections to withhold funds from any inmate account belonging to the defendant.  

No contact with K.S., DOB : 08-01-2000 without agent approval.

No contact with any person under the age of 18 without prior agent approval except with incidental contact.  

Have no jobs with anyone under the age of 18 without agent approval.  

Comply with sex offender registry for the period of supervision followed by 15 years after discharge;

Defendant is subject to GPS monitoring if the department feels it is necessary;

No internet access or use of social media without prior agent approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letter from Christy Mrotek.
Cover Letter

Sentencing Report prepared by Jacqueline A. Schmidt.
Cover letter.
All records scanned and verified.

Order to Revoke Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the recognizance bond of the defendant is revoked and custody of the defendant is remanded to the Manitowoc County Jail until sentencing in this matter.
Copy of order delivered to jail.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defendant in custody.
Attorney Prost moves to revoke bail in this matter.  The defendant was taken into custody on a charge of bail jumping last night which involved the same victim.  The defendant has already been convicted and is awaiting sentencing.
Attorney Snavely responds and asks that bond remain in place.
The Court comments and order bail revoked in this matter.
State to draft the order.
Minutes.

Defendant wants an independent pre-sentence investigation report.   Court grants the request.   Report to be filed by 02-16-17.   Sentencing hearing is reset to 02-23-17 at 11:00 a.m.   Court amends defendant's recognizance bond to add a condition that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department by 11:00 a.m. Monday through Friday as well as the defendant will not use or have access to any internet enabled devices.    All other conditions remain in effect.  
Minutes.

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information which amends count 1 to 3rd degree sexual assault, contrary to Section 940.225(3) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 1 of the Amended Information.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3 and 4. Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI is due on 01-05-17.
Sentencing is set for 01-12-17 at 10:00 a.m.
The Court orders defendant to submit to a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Request for Substitution of Judge filed by defendant. Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 10-28-2015 at 11:00 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 08-31-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defndant is to have no contact with any of the victims and no contact with anyone under 18.   Bail furnished.    
Minutes.

RE:  K.S., DOB: 01-18-2000, between 05-13-15 and 06-22-15.
Initial appearance is set for 08-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.
